hiqfermion.drivers package¶

Submodules¶

hiqfermion.drivers.gaussian_calculator module¶

The module of calling Gaussian16 to do calculations based on the input MolecularData and update the MolecularData inplace.

example import modules:
 
from hiqfermion.drivers import MolecularData
from hiqfermion.drivers import GaussianCalculator
example single molecule:
 
geometry =[('H', (0., 0., 0.)), ('H', (0., 0., 0.74))] 
description = 'g16_sto-3g_1_0_h2'
basis = 'sto3g'
multiplicity = 1
charge = 0
molecule = MolecularData(geometry,
                         basis,
                         multiplicity,
                         charge,
                         description = description)
molecule.gaussian_keys='scf(conventional)'
print ('name:', molecule.name)
print ('geometry:', molecule.geometry)
gs_h2 = GaussianCalculator(molecule)
gs_h2.excute()
class hiqfermion.drivers.gaussian_calculator.GaussianCalculator(molecule)¶

Bases: hiqfermion.drivers._calculator.Calculator

The class to do quantum chemistry calculations by Gaussian16.

Args:
molecular_data:The hiqfermion molecular data type which includes geometry, basis, multiplicity, charge and so on.
Returns:

By using GaussianCalculator.excute() the calculator will call g16 to do quantum chemistry calculation and update the corresponding input MolecularData object.
ao2mo_two(ints, mo_coeff)¶
build(para)¶

Generate SCF job based on the parameters

calculate(infile)¶

Carry out numerical calculation.

excute()¶
get_results_from_matfile(fname)¶
parametrization(molecule)¶

Collect parameters needed by SCF from MolecularData.

Args:
molecule:A MolecularData object.
Returns:
parameters:dict. Dict with corresponding keys and values. Basis, spin and charge are necessary parameters and other parameters are also supported
update(fname)¶

hiqfermion.drivers.hamiltonian_simplification module¶

The module used to simplify the molecular hamiltonian by a list of qubit index you want to remove from the vqe calculation.

example how to use:
 
hiqfermion.drivers.hamiltonian_simplification.hamiltonian_cut(hamiltonian, index_list)¶

The function used to cut the hamiltonian by given index_list.

Args:
hamiltonian(QubitOperator):
 The molecular hamiltonian.
index_list:The list of qubit index you want to remove from the qubit hamiltonian.
Returns:
new_hamiltonian(QubitOperator):
 The new molecular hamiltonian after simplification

hiqfermion.drivers.nwchem_calculator module¶

The module of using NWChem to do quantum chemistry calculations. In this module your hiqfermion input object will be translated into a NWChem style input file.

example hiqfermion style object:
 
from hiqfermion.drivers import MolecularData
geometry =[('H', (0., 0., 0.)), ('H', (0., 0., 0.834))] 
description = str(abs(geometry[0][1][2] - geometry[1][1][2]))
basis = 'sto-3g'
multiplicity = 1
charge = 0
molecule = MolecularData(geometry,
                         basis,
                         multiplicity,
                         charge,
                         description = description)
print ('name:', molecule.name)
print ('geometry:', molecule.geometry)
example nwchem style input file h2.nw:
 
title "H2_sto-3g_singlet ccsd Energy"
geometry
  H 0.0 0.0 0.0
  H 0.0 0.0 0.74
end
basis
  * library sto-3g
end
task ccsd energy
example how to use nwchem_calculator:
 
from hiqfermion.drivers import MolecularData
from hiqfermion.drivers import nwchem_calculator
geometry =[('H', (0., 0., 0.)), ('Li', (0., 0., 0.834))] 
description = str(abs(geometry[0][1][2] - geometry[1][1][2]))
basis = 'sto-3g'
multiplicity = 1
charge = 0
molecule = MolecularData(geometry,
                         basis,
                         multiplicity,
                         charge,
                         description = description)
print ('name:', molecule.name)
print ('geometry:', molecule.geometry)
nw_h2 = nwchem_calculator(molecule)
nw_h2.excute()

hiqfermion.drivers.nwchem_inputfile_generator module¶

Generate a nwchem input file from molecular data. The input molecule data structure must be a hiqfermion_molecular_data type.

example hiqfermion input molecular data:
 
from hiqfermion.drivers import MolecularData
geometry =[('H', (0., 0., 0.)), ('H', (0., 0., 0.74))] 
basis = 'sto3g'
multiplicity = 1
charge = 0
molecule = MolecularData(geometry,
                         basis,
                         multiplicity,
                         charge)
molecule.load()
example nwchem input file h2.nw:
 
title "H2 sto-3g CCSD Energy"
geometry
  h 0 0 0
  h 0 0 0.5
end
basis
  * library sto-3g
end
task ccsd energy
hiqfermion.drivers.nwchem_inputfile_generator.geometry_transform(molecular_geometry)¶

Change the geometry into nwchem input file format.

Args:
molecular_geometry:
 The hiqfermion molecular data geometry format.
Returns:
nwchem_geometry(str):
 The nwchem format geometry
hiqfermion.drivers.nwchem_inputfile_generator.save_nw_in(molecular_data, energy_type='ccsd')¶

Save the hiqfermion molecular data into a nwchem input file

Args:
molecular_data:The hiqfermion molecular data type which includes geometry, basis, multiplicity, charge and so on.
Returns:

Return None but save the molecular informations.

hiqfermion.drivers.psi4_calculator module¶

The main module of using psi4 to do calculations on input file molecule.in which generated from psi4_inputfile_generator and output a molecule.out file which contains all output informations about your input molecule.

example import modules:
 
from hiqfermion.drivers import MolecularData
from hiqfermion.drivers import Psi4Calculator
example single molecule:
 
geometry =[('H', (0., 0., 0.)), ('H', (0., 0., 0.834))] 
description = str(abs(geometry[0][1][2] - geometry[1][1][2]))
basis = 'sto-3g'
multiplicity = 1
charge = 0
molecule = MolecularData(geometry,
                         basis,
                         multiplicity,
                         charge,
                         description = description)
print ('name:', molecule.name)
print ('geometry:', molecule.geometry)
psi4_h2 = Psi4Calculator(molecule)
psi4_h2.excute()
example multi molecule:
 
geometry =[('H', (0., 0., 0.)), ('H', (0., 0., 0.844))] 
description = str(abs(geometry[0][1][2] - geometry[1][1][2]))
basis = 'sto-3g'
multiplicity = 1
charge = 0
molecule1 = MolecularData(geometry,
                         basis,
                         multiplicity,
                         charge,
                         description = description)
print ('name:', molecule1.name)
print ('geometry:', molecule1.geometry)
geometry =[('H', (0., 0., 0.)), ('H', (0., 0., 0.854))] 
description = str(abs(geometry[0][1][2] - geometry[1][1][2]))
basis = 'sto-3g'
multiplicity = 1
charge = 0
molecule2 = MolecularData(geometry,
                         basis,
                         multiplicity,
                         charge,
                         description = description)
print ('name:', molecule2.name)
print ('geometry:', molecule2.geometry)
psi4_h2 = Psi4Calculator([molecule1, molecule2], multimolecule = True)
psi4_h2.excute()

hiqfermion.drivers.psi4_inputfile_generator module¶

Generate a psi4 input file from molecular data. The input molecule data structure must be a hiqfermion_molecular_data type.

example hiqfermion input molecular data:
 
from hiqfermion.drivers import MolecularData
geometry =[('H', (0., 0., 0.)), ('H', (0., 0., 0.74))] 
basis = 'sto3g'
multiplicity = 1
charge = 0
molecule = MolecularData(geometry,
                         basis,
                         multiplicity,
                         charge)
molecule.load()
example psi4 input file h2.in:
 
molecule h2{
    H 0 0 0
    H 0 0 0.4
}
set basis cc-pVDZ
energy('scf')

 The hiqfermion molecular data geometry format.
Returns:

 The psi4 format geometry

Save the hiqfermion molecular data into a psi4 input file

Args:
molecular_data:The hiqfermion molecular data type which includes geometry, basis, multiplicity, charge and so on.
Returns:

Return None but save the molecular informations.

hiqfermion.drivers.pyscf_calculator module¶

The module of calling Gaussian16 to do calculations based on the input MolecularData and update the MolecularData inplace.

example import modules:
 
from hiqfermion.drivers import MolecularData
from hiqfermion.drivers import PyscfCalculator
example single molecule:
 
geometry =[('H', (0., 0., 0.)), ('H', (0., 0., 0.74))] 
description = 'pyscf_sto-3g_1_0_h2'
basis = 'sto3g'
multiplicity = 1
charge = 0
molecule = MolecularData(geometry,
                         basis,
                         multiplicity,
                         charge,
                         description = description)
print ('name:', molecule.name)
print ('geometry:', molecule.geometry)
ps_h2 = PyscfCalculator(molecule)
ps_h2.excute()
example post-HF:
 
geometry = [('H', (0., 0., 0.)), ('H', (0., 0., 0.74))] 
description = 'g16_sto-3g_1_0_h2'
basis = 'sto3g'
multiplicity = 1
charge = 0
molecule = MolecularData(geometry,
                         basis,
                         multiplicity,
                         charge,
                         description = description)
print ('name:', molecule.name)
print ('geometry:', molecule.geometry)
ps_h2 = PyscfCalculator(molecule, posthf = ['CCSD', 'Fci']) #case insensitive keys for the post-hf jobs 
ps_h2.excute()
print ('FCI-CCSD:', molecule.fci_energy - molecule.ccsd_energy)
class hiqfermion.drivers.pyscf_calculator.Calculator¶

Bases: object

warning_raise(txt)¶
class hiqfermion.drivers.pyscf_calculator.PyscfCalculator(molecule, posthf=[])¶

Bases: hiqfermion.drivers.pyscf_calculator.Calculator

A driver to PyScf. PyscfCalculator.excute() to run the job.

Args:
molecule:A ‘MolecularData’ object with the geometry, basis, spin and charge infomation.
posthf:List of string to indicate what kind of posthf jobs should run. The key should be one (or more) of the following words [‘ccsd’,’ccsd(t)’,’fci’,’cisd’] The keywords are case insensitive.
Returns:

By using PyscfCalculator.excute() the calculator will call Pyscf to do quantum chemistry calculation and update the corresponding input MolecularData object.
build()¶

Generate gto class for the following quantum chemistry calculation

the gto.Mole() class will be builded.

calculate()¶

Carry out numerical calculation

RHF/ROHF calculation will be carried out. FCI/CCSD/CCSD(T)/CISD jobs will be run if the corresponding keyword in posthf is provided.

excute()¶

excute the calculation and update the moleucle class.

get_ccsd_double_amps()¶

Get the ccsd double amps.

Returns:np.array contain ccsd double amps. The shape is (no+nv, no+nv, no+nv, no+nv) in which no is the number of occupied orbitals and nv virtual orbitals.
get_ccsd_single_amps()¶

Get the ccsd single amps.

Returns:np.array contain ccsd single amps. The shape is (no+nv, no+nv) in which no is the number of occupied orbitals and nv virtual orbitals.
get_one_ele_integrals()¶

Generate one electron integrals.

Returns:np.array contain one ele integrals.
get_property()¶
get_two_ele_integrals()¶

Generate two electron integrals.

Returns:np.array contain two ele integrals.
make_new_moleculedata()¶
parametrization(molecule)¶

Collect parameters needed by SCF from MolecularData and convert them to dictionary

Args:
molecule:A ‘MolecularData’ object with the geometry, basis, spin and charge infomation.
Returns:

Dict with corresponding keys and values. Basis, spin and charge are necessary parameters and other arbitrary.
posthf_build(posthf)¶
update()¶

Update the MolecularData with calculated properties.
